 ## Building Presto
 
-Presto is a standard Maven project. Simply run the following command from the project root directory:
+Presto is a standard Maven project. Simply run the following command from the
+project root directory:
 
     ./mvnw clean install
 
-On the first build, Maven will download all the dependencies from the internet and cache them in the local repository (`~/.m2/repository`), which can take a considerable amount of time. Subsequent builds will be faster.
+On the first build, Maven will download all the dependencies from the internet

timeline.bodyText: Maybe not talk about org .. just talk about .. if you do not have Docker installed...

@@ -18,50 +18,82 @@
 ## Requirements
 
 * Mac OS X or Linux
-* Java 11, 64-bit
+* Java 11.0.8 or later, 64-bit
 * Python 2.6+ (for running with the launcher script)
-* Docker (for building and running tests)
+* Docker (for building and running tests, and for building documentation)
 
 ## Building Presto
 
-Presto is a standard Maven project. Simply run the following command from the project root directory:
+Presto is a standard Maven project. Simply run the following command from the
+project root directory:
 
     ./mvnw clean install
 
-On the first build, Maven will download all the dependencies from the internet and cache them in the local repository (`~/.m2/repository`), which can take a considerable amount of time. Subsequent builds will be faster.
+On the first build, Maven will download all the dependencies from the internet
+and cache them in the local repository (`~/.m2/repository`), which can take a
+considerable amount of time. Subsequent builds will be faster.
 
-Presto has a comprehensive set of unit tests that can take several minutes to run. You can disable the tests when building:
+Presto has a comprehensive set of unit tests that can also take a considerable
+amount of time to run. You can disable the tests when building:
 
     ./mvnw clean install -DskipTests
 
+If you experience a build fail, in many cases you can resume the build once you
+have corrected the build issue by simply leaving the 'clean' argument out of the
+build command:
+
+    ./mvnw install -DskipTests
+
+If your organization does not allow the use of Docker, you can skip building

replies.bodyText: We discussed and agreed to remove the parentheses and just say that Docker is a hard requirement (as various parts of the build use it and we expect more in the future)
replies.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: These line wrapping changes are formatting changes, which should be done as a separate commit that only changes formatting (no content changes). It's hard to review content changes when formatting changes are mixed together.

timeline.bodyText: We no longer accurate, as we no longer provide instructions for (or support) building documentation without Docker.
timeline.author: electrum
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -15,53 +15,85 @@

-## Requirements +## Build requirements * Mac OS X or Linux -* Java 11, 64-bit +* Java 11.0.8, 64-bit * Python 2.6+ (for running with the launcher script) -* Docker (for building and running tests) +* Docker (for building and running tests, and for building documentation) ## Building Presto -Presto is a standard Maven project. Simply run the following command from the project root directory: +Presto is a standard Maven project. Simply run the following command from the +project root directory: ./mvnw clean install -On the first build, Maven will download all the dependencies from the internet and cache them in the local repository (`~/.m2/repository`), which can take a considerable amount of time. Subsequent builds will be faster. +On the first build, Maven downloads all the dependencies from the internet +and caches them in the local repository (`~/.m2/repository`), which can take a +considerable amount of time. Subsequent builds are faster. -Presto has a comprehensive set of unit tests that can take several minutes to run. You can disable the tests when building: +Presto has a comprehensive set of unit tests that can also take a considerable +amount of time to run. You can disable the tests when building: ./mvnw clean install -DskipTests +If you experience a build fail, in many cases you can resume the build once you +have corrected the build issue by simply leaving the `clean` argument out of the +build command: + + ./mvnw install -DskipTests + +If you do not use Docker, you can skip building the documentation and running +unit tests by using the following command: + + ./mvnw -pl '!presto-docs' clean install -DskipTests + +See the "Default build" section of [presto-docs README](./presto-docs/README.md)

replies.bodyText: removed any reference to building w/o docker
